oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Belle Boyd
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Carte de visite portrait of Confederate spy Belle Boyd.

Isabelle Marie Boyd (1844-1900) was a Confederate spy who operated from her father's hotel in Front Royal, Virginia. In one instance, at age seventeen, she provided valuable information about Yankee troop movements to General Stonewall Jackson during his attack on Federal troops in Front Royal. She was arrested several times. In 1864, she made her way to England and returned to the U. S. in 1866. She once provided valuable information on Yankee troop movements to General Thomas J. �Stonewall� Jackson. Belle fled to England in 1864.
